snippet: Prime Minister Enrico Letta said he would resign after his Democratic Party staged a dramatic insurrection and set the stage to replace him with the party’s new leader, Matteo Renzi.
abstract: Italian Prime Min Enrico Letta, whose weak coalition government has come under criticism, says he will resign; announcement follows insurrection staged by his own Democratic Party to replace him with party's new leader Matteo Renzi.

byline.contributor: Elisabetta Povoledo and Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Enrico Letta said he would resign after his Democratic Party staged a dramatic insurrection and set the stage to replace him with the party’s new leader, Matteo Renzi.

headline.main: Italy’s Prime Minister Announces Resignation Amid Party Revolt
headline.print_headline: Italy’s Prime Minister Announces Resignation Amid Party Revolt
